clean_content:
Definition / general

* Most SLE patients have cervical lymphadenopathy

Case reports

* 32 year old woman with coexisting Kukuchi disease ([Int J Dermatol 2006;45:454](16650177))* Patient with coexisting Castleman disease ([J Rheumatol 1999;26:1400](10381064))

Microscopic (histologic) description

* Architectural preservation but follicular hyperplasia with variable sized follicles, increased vascularity, interfollicular immunoblasts and plasma cells* Often well circumscribed areas of paracortical necrosis with necrosis of small vessels ([APMIS 2001;109:141](11398995))* Occasionally DNA deposition / hematoxylin bodies (hematoxyphilic material) in stroma, sinuses and blood vessel walls* May have giant follicles ([APMIS 2005;113:558](16086828)), often disarray of follicular dendritic cell network ([Pathol Int 2000;50:304](10849316)), no / rare granulomas, no / rare neutrophils

Microscopic (histologic) images

Images hosted on other servers:  

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/lymphnodessle_unibas01.jpeg)](https://pathorama.ch/pathopic/003752/show)
â€ƒ
[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/lymphnodessle_unibas02.jpeg)](https://pathorama.ch/pathopic/003751/show)

Necrotizing lymphadenopathy

Cytology description

* Typical and atypical immunoblasts, plasma cells, occasional Reed-Sternberg-like cells and dispersed hematoxylin bodies ([Acta Cytol 2000;44:67](10667163))

Positive stains

* [CD11b](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/cdmarkerscd10to19.html#cd11b)+ and [CD15](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/cdmarkerscd15.html)+ histiocytes* [CD8](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/cdmarkerscd8.html)+ T cells, [EBV](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainseber1.html) (up to 20%, [Int J Surg Pathol 2005;13:273](16086083))

Differential diagnosis

* [Castleman disease](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/lymphnodescastleman.html) ([Pathol Res Pract 1997;193:565](9406250))* [Cat scratch disease](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/lymphnodescatscratch.html): has neutrophils* [Kikuchi disease](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/lymphnodeskikuchi.html): less prominent follicular hyperplasia and interfollicular plasma cells, more prominent immunoblasts resembling lymphoma* [Lymphogranuloma venereum](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/lymphnodesotherinfections.html#lymphogranulomavenereum): has granulomas* **Polykaryocytes**
